intro: Marcgravia parviflora var. sprucei, commonly known as the Spruce's small-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows on the branches of host trees, deriving some of its nutrients through specialized roots. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture, while its fruits are small capsules that release seeds when mature. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and morphological features.
